https://prez.dev/description.@value: A categorization of disciplines or topics that the broad field of Earth science can be subdivided into, i.e. a listing of the Fields of Research, or subjects, to which a geoscience dataset, publication, observation/activity, or entity pertains. The vocabulary also contains relevant disciplines that intersect with the various Earth science fields, such as biological sciences and built environment and design, as well as entries related to collection and heritage management. Notations included are those from the 2020 ANZSRC listing (see History Note) or in common use in the geoscience community.

http://www.w3.org/2004/02/skos/core#defi.@value: The dating of geological materials by using the effects of radioactivity other than the natural decay from a parent to a daughter isotope. It includes methods such as fission tracks (measure of the density of track marking left in a material by the spontaneous fission of uranium-238 impurities), luminescence (measure of the effect of background radiation on certain minerals), and electron spin resonance (ESR), measure of the amount of unpaired electrons in crystalline structures that were previously exposed to natural radiation). The term radiogenic here is used as in Colman et al. (1987).

http://www.w3.org/2004/02/skos/core#hist.@value:
Compiled by the Geological Survey of Western Australia. Definition based on:
Colman, SM, Pierce, KL and Birkeland, PW 1987, Suggested terminology for Quaternary dating methods: Quaternary Research, v. 28(2), p. 314â€“319, doi:10.1016/0033-5894(87)90070-6.
